result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on October 25, 2022
Wisconsin Waukesha County Uniform Property Inventory Receipt

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victims A-C/Butler Tool listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within .5 mile of Victims A-C/Butler Tool, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  
 **BEFORE THE DEFENDANT CAN BE RELEASED** 
The Defendant's wife shall turn in all firearms listed on the Statement of Possession of Firearms to the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department; once a receipt is turned in then the Defendant can be released.

2:12 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Bruce W Rickert in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Bruce W Rickert. Attorney appears as friend of the court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
The Defendant fills out a Statement of Possession of Firearms. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. 
 **BEFORE THE DEFENDANT CAN BE RELEASED** 
The Defendant's wife shall turn in all firearms listed on the Statement of Possession of Firearms to the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department; once a receipt is turned in then the Defendant can be released.
Hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Bruce W Rickert
Current: 3402 S 63rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53219   (Effective: 10-24-2022)
Prior: 3402 S 63re Street, Milwaukee, WI 53219
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
